column4: ok i google and i found nothing, but here is my problem: i think the my keyboard is interfering with the linux ( the sound icon blinks, and i can't write almost nothing) if anyone cold help i appreciate ;), if not thank u anyway
Okay... let me break it down more. When you type on the keyboard, the sound icon blinks?
yes
I wonder if there is a window that requires input that is hidden. Try hitting Alt-Tab a couple times to cycle between windows.
Sometimes dialog boxes get lost and you end up with unresponsive keyboard, and it's just a box you need to close.
You might also try using Unity shortcut Ctrl-Alt-Up Arrow to expose all windows and select one to give focus to.
Did that work?
no didn't work. it still's blinks
You're using a USB keyboard?
Is it a USB wireless keyboard?
yes is a wireless (Microsoft Keyboard)
Check out https://help.ubuntu.com/community/InstallUSBKeyboard
It might be a BIOS setting you need to change.
what is need to change in BIOS? and how i go to the BIOS in linux?
Umm, does this sound like your problem? https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/xserver-xorg-input-evdev/+bug/636311
This is an old bug, it shouldn't be around anymore...
What Ubuntu version are you using?
yeah is that bug
Wow. Okay, file a bug report. That bug hadn't been confirmed in 11.04.
ok, how do I file a bug report?
On this page https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/xserver-xorg-input-evdev/+bug/636311 you'll need to click the + sign for "Also affects distribution" and add 11.04 as an affected distribution.
You will likely need to log in or create an account on Launchpad when you do that.
ok and thanks,  u been helpful. peace ;)
